summary: This is a Federal Bureau of Prisons (BOP) Program Statement (P3420.11) titled 'Standards of Employee Conduct', approved by Director Charles E. Samuels, Jr. It establishes comprehensive ethical and conduct policies for all BOP employees, contractors, and volunteers, covering areas such as conflicts of interest, outside employment, relationships with inmates, confidentiality, and procurement integrity. It includes a detailed schedule of disciplinary offenses and penalties.

persons.name: Charles E. Samuels, Jr.
persons.context: Approved the Program Statement 'Standards of Employee Conduct' as the Director of the Federal Bureau of Prisons.

events.title: Issuance of BOP Standards of Employee Conduct
events.description: The Federal Bureau of Prisons issued Program Statement P3420.11, 'Standards of Employee Conduct', which rescinded and replaced the previous version from 1999.

keyFacts: The document is the official BOP policy on employee conduct, ethics, and disciplinary procedures, applicable to all employees, contractors, and volunteers.

It explicitly prohibits sexual relationships or contact with inmates, stating 'There is never any such thing as consensual sex between staff and inmates' and mandates reporting and investigation of such allegations.
It outlines strict rules against conflicts of interest, outside employment (requiring prior approval for certain professions), and post-employment restrictions.
It includes a detailed 'Standard Schedule of Disciplinary Offenses and Penalties' (Attachment A) listing 56 specific offenses with recommended penalty ranges for first, second, and third offenses.

The policy mandates employees to immediately report any violations of conduct standards, breaches of security, or criminal charges/arrests to their Chief Executive Officer or other appropriate authority.
